an8.12:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
an8.12:4.2: Now at that time several very prominent Licchavis were sitting together at the meeting hall, praising the Buddha, his teaching, and the Saṅgha in many ways.
an8.12:5.1: Now at that time General Sīha, a disciple of the Jains, was sitting in that assembly.
an8.12:5.3: “That Blessed One must certainly be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha. For several very prominent Licchavis are praising the Buddha, his teaching, and the Saṅgha in many ways.

an8.12:32.1: Then Sīha saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the Dhamma. He went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. He said to the Buddha:
an8.12:32.2: “Sir, may the Buddha together with the mendicant Saṅgha please accept tomorrow’s meal from me.”
an8.12:32.4: Then, knowing that the Buddha had accepted, Sīha got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
an8.12:33.1: Then Sīha addressed a certain man:
an8.12:33.2: “Mister, please find out if there is any meat ready for sale.”
an8.12:33.3: And when the night had passed General Sīha had a variety of delicious foods prepared in his own home, and announced the time to the Buddha, saying:
an8.12:33.4: “Sir, it’s time. The meal is ready.”
an8.12:34.1: Then the Buddha got dressed in the morning and, taking his bowl and robes, went to Sīha’s home,
an8.12:34.2: where he sat on the indicated seat, together with the Saṅgha of mendicants.
an8.12:34.3: Now at that time many Jain ascetics in Vesālī went street to street and square to square, calling out with raised arms:
an8.12:34.4: “Today General Sīha has slaughtered a fat calf for the ascetic Gotama’s meal.
an8.12:34.5: The ascetic Gotama knowingly eats meat prepared on purpose for him: this is a deed he caused.”

an8.12:36.3: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired him with a Dharma talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.
